title: Spinach and Celery Salad with Lemon Vinaigrette
summary: You can never have too many side dish recipes, so give Spinach and Celery Salad with Lemon Vinaigrette a try. One portion of this dish contains approximately 12g of protein, 17g of fat, and a total of 215 calories. This gluten free, primal, vegetarian, and ketogenic recipe serves 6 and costs $1.38 per serving. 1 person were impressed by this recipe. From preparation to the plate, this recipe takes around 45 minutes. A mixture of baby spinach leaves, celery stalks, asiago-pepper frico, and a handful of other ingredients are all it takes to make this recipe so delicious. All things considered, we decided this recipe deserves a spoonacular score of 88%. This score is excellent. Similar recipes include Spinach and Radicchio Salad with Lemon Vinaigrette, Spinach Salad with Smoked Salmon, Everything Bagel Croutons and Lemon-Caper Vinaigrette, and Shaved Celery Salad with Rhubarb Vinaigrette.
instructions: Preparation                                                        Combine celery and spinach in large bowl. Drizzle olive oil and lemon juice over; sprinkle generously with salt and pepper and toss to coat. Divide among 6 plates. Top each with 2 Asiago-Pepper Frico.                                                Test-kitchen tip:            A mandoline, V-slicer, or other flat slicer-type tool with a sharp blade makes easy work of slicing the celery stalks thinly. Find one at surlatable.com.

steps.step: Combine celery and spinach in large bowl.
Drizzle olive oil and lemon juice over; sprinkle generously with salt and pepper and toss to coat. Divide among 6 plates. Top each with 2 Asiago-Pepper Frico.
A mandoline, V-slicer, or other flat slicer-type tool with a sharp blade makes easy work of slicing the celery stalks thinly. Find one at surlatable.com.
